I use run-length encoding a fair bit, and wrote {purler} in order to have some features not available in base::rle()

* 10x faster (using C code)
* Intuitive handling of NAs
* Result returned as a data.frame for tidy manipulation!

Now with hex!

With all this #AcademicChatter going on about data cleaning and processing, I must admit I've never actually been taught *how* to clean data. Any good tutorials or checklists? I'm often afraid there are data cleaning steps I'm missing or overlooking  #RStats

You can use the %<>% operator (in the magrittr package) to update an object with a pipe. 

  a %<>% f %>% g

is the same as 

  a <- a %>% f %>% g 

https://t.co/2kEyvvieMb #rstats
